thread.title: There's A Ridiculous Transfer Rumour Involving Inter Milan And Manchester City's Gabriel Jesus
thread.title_full: There's A Ridiculous Transfer Rumour Involving Inter Milan And Manchester City's Gabriel Jesus

title: There's A Ridiculous Transfer Rumour Involving Inter Milan And Manchester City's Gabriel Jesus
text:
There's A Ridiculous Transfer Rumour Involving Inter Milan And Manchester City's Gabriel Jesus Wed Feb 15 2017 21:17:32 GMT+0000 (GMT) Wed Feb 15 2017 21:17:32 GMT+0000 (GMT) Josh Lawless Josh Lawless in football 
Silly transfer rumours frequently pop up these days and pretty much most of the transfer stories I find myself writing don't actually end up happening. 
But there's one ridiculous rumour that has come about today and it involves Inter Milan and Manchester City new boy Gabriel Jesus. 
The Brazilian signed for City in the summer for a fee of Â£27 million but remained with Palmeiras for their Brazilian Serie A season and fired them to the title. 
He joined up with City at the end of January and started on fire in England, scoring three times in three Premier League starts as well as contributing further with two assists. 
But the 19-year old's fate changed dramatically on Monday against Bournemouth at the Vitality Stadium when he suffered a fractured metatarsal just 15 minutes into the game and had to be brought off. 
He's now set to be out for around two to three months but that hasn't stopped him being linked with a move to Inter Milan. 
Inter get linked with just about every player under the sun and now Sky Italia are reporting that the club's Chinese owners Suning are desperate to land Jesus in the summer. They are said to have tried to sign the Brazilian, seen as one of the most exciting prospects in world football, in the summer, but were beaten to his signature by City. 
Reports in Italy say that Steven Zhang , the main man in Inter's Chinese ownership, is a big fan of Jesus and they will push to sign him in the summer. 
If we're being honest, it's just not happening at all is it? 
Manchester City fans couldn't help but laugh at the story that emerged today. Ambitious China-backed Inter plan audacious bid to sign Gabriel Jesus this summer. [Sky Italia] https://t.co/MNkM5kCUxP pic.twitter.com/x5sIybX9y0 - City Watch (@City_Watch) February 15, 2017 
Inter's former president Massimo Moratti has also talked up Jesus and said he made him "fall in love" with football again. 
As quoted by the Daily Mail, he said: 
"'Every now and again you need this new kind of player to reignite your passion and Gabriel Jesus of Manchester City is, for me, a player you have got to pursue. 
"He made me fall in love with football again." 
Sorry Inter, this isn't happening. This rumour goes straight in the bullshit bin.
